title: More than Enough: A children's picture book about saving
text:
More than Enough: A children's picture book about saving

A simple a story about acorns and why our squirrel family collects them.

More than Enough is a story about a young squirrel who sets out with her mother one autumn morning to collect acorns.

It is simple a story about acorns and why our squirrel family collects them – to eat, to enjoy, to share, to save and to grow for the years to come.

But the book also delivers a strong message: about investing that explores concepts such as time, saving, income generation, compounding, diversification, risk, patience and investing for the long term.

The first in a series in the theme of saving, the short story is authored by communications manager Christina Castle of Foord Asset Management, and beautifully illustrated by Carla Kreuser.

"These are the basic investment principles that we drive at Foord," says Castle. "If you understand and embrace these principles from an early age, you can only be set on the path to successful investing."

Foord will be freely distributing More than Enough to libraries and schools throughout the country, so that parents and teachers can start engaging their kids about how important it is to start saving early.

Contact info@foord.co.za for a copy of More than Enough or for more information about the series.
